channel.title: Perl Weekly newsletter
channel.description: A free, once a week e-mail round-up of hand-picked news and articles about Perl.

item.title: #172 - And the Silver Camel Goes To...
item.description: This weekend was rocking Perl on both sides of the Atlantic. On the New World side: The Pittsburgh Perl Workshop. Meanwhile in the Old World: the London Perl Workshop. No doubt helped by a 6 hours headstart, echoes and reports already began to trickle about the latter event. Amongst other things: Mark Keating was awarded the Silver Camel (congrats!). Of the PPW nary a word yet, but you can bet that will change by next week. Till then, enjoy! `/anick
item.dc:subject: list of tags?

item.title: Mojo News: Mango
item.description: Mango is no go anymore, announces Glen Hinkle, as the project has been deprecated.

item.title: Shutting down the Perl Community AdServer
item.description: It's time to say farewell... Gabor Szabo lets us know that the Perl community adserver is going down.

item.title: A new Perl 6 community server - call for funding
item.description: The Perl 6 community needs a new server. Moritz Lenz tells you how you can pitch in.

item.title: The Silver Camel goes to ... Mark Keating
item.description: At the London Perl Workshop, Neil Bowers happily reports, Mark Keating was awarded a Silver Camel for his excellent work within the Perl community. Well-deserved and, oh my, that's one heck of a spiffy trophy.

item.title: What's new on CPAN - October 2014
item.description: David Farrell gives us the new modules that made their apparition in October.

item.title: Create skeleton PSGI application for the SCO project
item.description: Instead of working 'according to the book' and writing all the acceptance tests first, Gabor started to build the actually web application by setting up the PSGI skeleton.

item.title: Start using Template Toolkit to show the empty pages
item.description: Embedding HTML in the Perl code is a no-go. All the HTML needs to be in separate template files.

item.title: Quick post-LPW roundup
item.description: Toby Inkster quickly jolts down his favorite talks of the event.

item.title: The London Perl Workshop 2014
item.description: Neil Bowers gives us an overview of the talks he attended this year at the LPW.

item.title: Printing function calls in Perl
item.description: Paul Evans shows a few way one can imbed the result of a function call within a string.

item.title: Semantic Versioning Your Way
item.description: Yanick updated his semantic version plugin for Dist::Zilla to accommodate all and any of the common versioning schemes CPAN modules use.

item.title: Fumbling Toward CatalystX::Info
item.description: Yanick Champoux was left alone for a whole week-end. This never ends well...

item.title: CPAN Great Modules Released Last Week
Meta::CPAN
item.description: A collection of MetaCPAN related articles and screencasts. The audience starts from plain users, through CPAN module authors, all the way till MetaCPAN developers.

item.title: Regex character classes
item.description: The second part of the 'Introduction to Perl 5 Regexes' series.
